segments.text: Mom , can we get cable TV or a satellite dish ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It costs money , dear . What ’ s wrong with the regular television stations ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: The shows are dull and they ’ re too many advertisements .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , you already watch too much TV instead of doing your homework , anyway .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: There ’ re educational stations too . I could learn while I watched TV .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , that ’ s true , but you ’ d probably only watch cartoons and action movies .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No I wouldn ’ t ... can ’ t we get cable ? Everybody has cable .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , if everybody jumped off a bridge , would you jump too ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Mom ! ! ! Please . All my friends have had it for years .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Why are you always so mean ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Because you ’ d end up spoiled rotten if I wasn ’ t .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I could help pay for it .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Let ’ s see how your grades are this semester , and maybe I ’ ll talk to your father about it .
segments.speaker: S2
